title: @RiotRepertoir talon's passive
body:
i just wanted to ask you this question: what is your thought about his passive? because logically it's kinda awfull and one of the most useless passive ever...
-Talon doesn't use autoattacks so much
-Talon has only one spell to proc his passive
-The damage increase is horrible.. 10% meanwhile corki does 10% bonus true damage every hit without needing a slow and shaco does 20% bonus damage when attacking from behind.

so can you at least allow him to does bonus damage on spells too or reworking his passive?

replies.body:
Actually, I think an auto attack passive makes a lot of sense on Talon. That isn't to say his current passive is very good or fun, however. As you've mentioned above, Talon only has one real spell (maybe E does too if you're fast enough?) that triggers his passive, which (again as you've mentioned), for such a measly reward, just leaves it feeling like it's not even there in most cases. 

It would be pretty cool if we could figure out a way to modify his passive in such a way that it felt like there were good, rewarding payouts to doing it correctly, because give its current state, satisfaction really just doesn't seem all that possible.

Trying to make champions feel different is very good and admirable. But sometimes it doesn't work out as it was intended. Talon's passive was designed to reward for auto attacking, but the lack of items that give good ratios of AD and Atk speed, no built- in as buffs, and the presence of hard cc in every match is what makes this passive irrelevant.

My 2 euro cents.

An AA passive that doesn't depend on Attack speed? Oh look, a guaranteed AA boost that has a long internal cooldown, and doesn't proc multiple times per fight. 

Also, Talon's Damage full combo landing is pretty outrageously high already, and once he lands on you, there is no stopping him if you're alone.
Imagine a late game Talon just walking around and two-shotting everybody that got CC'ed lol.

Talon already has a supremely difficult time against tanks, and he has a hard time escaping from opponents. He's also squishy. he's one of the better balanced assassins in that He can only go one way, IN. Because this is on a 30 second internal cooldown, not a cooldown per unit, he has to select which target he wants to eliminate in a fight. 30 seconds is also roughly the same CD as his ult at 40% CDR. Also, because it doesn't stack with IE and is a guaranteed AA boost for a single auto, it means that one auto essentially becomes a single target spell.

If you want to argue that it'll make him too good at killing squishies, he's already really good at it, his full burst combo is enough to kill anyone with less than 100 armor and 2k hp or less. This simply means that late game, he can do a little better against tanks.

Attacking a slowed enemy deals bonus damage equal to the slow amount, _but removes the slow._

I.e. attacking a target slowed by 50% will deal 150% AD damage. His E slow would have to be nerfed with that... but still. Its an idea.

His E slow is 0.25 sec, you can't use E and AA in 0.25sec, unless you have a huge atk speed, and the atk speed build wouldn't work, because his E has a long cd.
Also it would be counter-productive. He needs the slow to auto attack after the combo, or enemy will run away, but he removes the slow when he auto attacks.
